description: Borrowed from Guyanese Creole English manicole, from Arawak manaka. The English word is cognate with Tariana mánaka, Yucuna manakóla.

entries.meaning: (Guyana) A palm tree of the genus Euterpe which is native to Central America, South America, and the West Indies; especially the açaí palm (Euterpe oleracea).
(Guyana, chiefly attributively) The Guyana manicole palm or manacachilla (Prestoea tenuiramosa), a species of palm tree native to South America; also, the wood of this tree.
